ground_truth: A handful of comics tumbles to the ground as the ponytail man straightens the wheelchair and starts down the aisle again. After a couple of feet, Elijah jerks and grabs the other wheel, sending the wheelchair ramming violently into the opposite wall, causing more comics to be knocked free and fall onto the wheelchair and the nearby ground. They move down the aisle, and all is quiet until Elijah jerks the wheelchair to the left again, causing his metal brace and the wheelchair to crash into two racks, covering Elijah in comics. The Ponytail man moves to the front counter, while Elijah sits in a trance—slightly hunched over—and his eyes stare at a comic book in his lap. His expression changes for the first time as the Ponytail man finishes dialing and looks over to Elijah as he waits for a voice on the other end. Elijah raises a single comic book in his hand. In a trendy restaurant, David and Audrey are on stools at one end of the bar, sipping their drinks as they appear in deep thought. Audrey leans slightly closer, and David's grin slowly fades; they're only a foot or so apart. David sips his drink slowly and glances at Audrey, who waits for his answer, her face tensing as she's on the verge of getting upset. Audrey's eyes glaze with water as David's eyes look up and make eye contact with hers, and he stares at her for the longest time. Husband and wife sit close together in the corner of the bar on their second date, and Audrey stands next to David as he pulls out his wallet. The babysitter with the black dyed hair and Buddy Holly glasses stands ready to leave in the doorway as Audrey tries to hide her smile, which instantly fades. The babysitter fixes her Buddy Holly glasses as she looks at the two suddenly quiet faces, and David hands her the money. She opens the door, and it's started to rain, so she covers her head with her jacket and runs down the walkway, closing the door behind her. Audrey takes off her coat as she moves to the guest bedroom and disappears inside. Only the counter light is on in the kitchen where David stands by the phone. The driver of the truck slips and slides his way over to David, who looks at Audrey laying shivering in the grass before looking back at the driver. Elijah closes his eyes, and his face fills with strength. The interior of the station is a mystical sight, with one huge cavernous room, a football field in size, lined on both sides with giant pillars rising into a misty hand-painted ceiling. David stands in a quiet corner and watches the faces of passengers arriving and departing late-night trains.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: A few comics fall to the floor as the ponytail man straightens the wheelchair and begins down the aisle again. After a couple of yards, Elijah jolts and clutches the other wheel, sending the wheelchair crashing violently into the opposite wall, causing more comics to be knocked loose and drop onto the wheelchair and the nearby floor. The Ponytail man moves to the front counter, while Elijah sits in a trance—slightly hunched over—and his eyes gaze at a comic book in his lap. His expression shifts for the first time as the Ponytail man finishes dialing and looks over to Elijah as he waits for a voice on the other end. Elijah lifts a single comic book in his hand. In a chic restaurant, David and Audrey are on stools at one end of the bar, sipping their beverages as they appear in deep thought. Audrey leans slightly closer, and David's grin slowly diminishes; they're only a foot or so apart. David sips his beverage slowly and glances at Audrey, who waits for his response, her face tensing as she's on the verge of getting upset. Audrey's eyes glaze with moisture as David's eyes look up and make eye contact with hers, and he gazes at her for the longest time. Husband and wife sit close together in the corner of the bar on their second date, and Audrey stands next to David as he pulls out his wallet. The babysitter with the ebony dyed hair and Buddy Holly glasses stands ready to leave in the doorway as Audrey tries to hide her grin, which instantly fades. The babysitter adjusts her Buddy Holly glasses as she looks at the two suddenly quiet faces, and David hands her the cash. She opens the door, and it's begun to rain, so she covers her head with her jacket and runs down the walkway, closing the door behind her. The driver of the truck slips and slides his way over to David, who looks at Audrey lying shivering in the grass before looking back at the driver. Elijah closes his eyes, and his face fills with fortitude. The interior of the station is a mystical sight, with one huge cavernous room, a football field in size, lined on both sides with giant pillars ascending into a misty hand-painted ceiling. David stands in a quiet corner and watches the faces of passengers arriving and departing late-night trains.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: A handful of comics is tumbled to the ground as the wheelchair is straightened by the ponytail man, and the aisle is started down again by him. After a couple of feet, the other wheel is grabbed by Elijah, and he jerks, sending the wheelchair ramming violently into the opposite wall, which causes more comics to be knocked free and fall onto the wheelchair and the nearby ground. The aisle is moved down by them, and all remains quiet until the wheelchair is jerked to the left again by Elijah, causing his metal brace and the wheelchair to crash into two racks, covering Elijah in comics. The front counter is moved to by the Ponytail man, while Elijah is seated in a trance—slightly hunched over—and a comic book is stared at in his lap by his eyes. As the Ponytail man finishes dialing and looks over to Elijah while he waits for a voice on the other end, his expression is changed for the first time. A single comic book is raised in Elijah’s hand. In a trendy restaurant, stools are occupied at one end of the bar by David and Audrey, who sip their drinks as they appear in deep thought. A slight lean brings Audrey closer, and David's grin slowly fades; they are only a foot or so apart. His drink is slowly sipped by David, who glances at Audrey, waiting for his answer, her face tensing as she is on the verge of getting upset. Audrey's eyes glaze with water as eye contact is made by David's eyes with hers, and she is stared at for the longest time. The corner of the bar hosts husband and wife sitting close together on their second date, and David stands next to Audrey as his wallet is pulled out. The babysitter with the black dyed hair and Buddy Holly glasses stands ready to leave in the doorway as a smile is tried to be hidden by Audrey, which instantly fades. The Buddy Holly glasses are fixed by the babysitter as she looks at the two suddenly quiet faces, and the money is handed to her by David. The door is opened by her, and it's started to rain, so her head is covered with her jacket as she runs down the walkway, closing the door behind her. Audrey’s coat is taken off as she moves to the guest bedroom and disappears inside. Only the counter light remains on in the kitchen where the phone is stood by David. The truck driver slips and slides his way over to David, who looks at Audrey lying shivering in the grass before looking back at the driver. Elijah’s eyes are closed, and his face is filled with strength. The interior of the station is seen as a mystical sight, with one huge cavernous room, a football field in size, which is lined on both sides with giant pillars rising into a misty hand-painted ceiling. A quiet corner is stood in by David who watches the faces of passengers arriving and departing late-night trains.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Comics scatter as the ponytail man straightens the wheelchair and moves down the aisle. Elijah jerks the wheel, crashing into the wall and knocking more comics to the ground. As they continue, Elijah jerks left, crashing into racks and covering himself in comics. The ponytail man dials at the counter while Elijah, in a trance, stares at a comic in his lap. In a trendy restaurant, David and Audrey sit at the bar, deep in thought. Audrey leans closer, and David's grin fades. He sips his drink, glancing at Audrey, whose eyes water as she waits for his answer. They sit close on their second date, and Audrey stands by David as he pays the babysitter. The babysitter, with black hair and Buddy Holly glasses, leaves as it starts to rain. Audrey moves to the guest bedroom, while David stands by the phone in the dimly lit kitchen. A truck driver approaches David, who looks at Audrey shivering in the grass. Elijah closes his eyes, filled with strength. The station's interior is mystical, with a vast room lined with giant pillars and a misty ceiling. David watches passengers arrive and depart late-night trains.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Comics fall as the ponytail man straightens the wheelchair and moves down the aisle. Elijah jerks, causing the wheelchair to crash into the wall, knocking more comics down. They continue, and Elijah jerks left, crashing into racks and covering himself in comics. The ponytail man dials at the counter while Elijah, in a trance, stares at a comic. Elijah raises a comic as the man waits for a response. In a trendy restaurant, David and Audrey sit at the bar, deep in thought. Audrey leans closer, and David's grin fades. David sips his drink, glancing at Audrey, whose eyes water as they make eye contact. On their second date, Audrey stands by David as he pays the babysitter, who leaves in the rain. Audrey moves to the guest bedroom, while David stands by the phone in the dim kitchen. A truck driver approaches David, who looks at Audrey shivering in the grass. Elijah closes his eyes, filled with strength. The station's interior is mystical, with a vast room and giant pillars. David watches passengers at late-night trains.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
A small collection of comics spills onto the floor as the man with a ponytail carefully adjusts the wheelchair and begins to move down the aisle once more. After advancing just a couple of feet, Elijah suddenly jerks and grabs hold of the other wheel, causing the wheelchair to crash violently into the opposite wall. This collision results in even more comics being dislodged and cascading down onto both the wheelchair and the surrounding floor. As they continue their journey down the aisle, a silence envelops them until Elijah abruptly jerks the wheelchair to the left again. This sudden movement causes his metal brace and the wheelchair to collide with two racks, showering Elijah with a cascade of comics. The man with the ponytail then makes his way to the front counter, while Elijah remains seated in a trance-like state—slightly hunched over—with his eyes fixated on a comic book resting in his lap. For the first time, his expression shifts as the man with the ponytail finishes dialing a number and glances over at Elijah while waiting for someone to answer on the other end. Elijah slowly raises a single comic book in his hand.

In a chic and trendy restaurant, David and Audrey find themselves perched on stools at one end of the bar, leisurely sipping their drinks as they appear to be lost in deep contemplation. Audrey leans in slightly closer, and David's grin gradually fades away; they are only about a foot apart. David takes a slow sip of his drink and glances at Audrey, who is waiting for his response, her face tensing as if she is on the brink of becoming upset. Audrey's eyes begin to glisten with moisture as David's gaze meets hers, and he holds her stare for what feels like an eternity. The husband and wife sit closely together in the corner of the bar, enjoying their second date, and Audrey stands beside David as he retrieves his wallet. The babysitter, with her black-dyed hair and Buddy Holly-style glasses, stands ready to leave in the doorway as Audrey attempts to conceal her smile, which quickly fades. The babysitter adjusts her Buddy Holly glasses as she observes the two suddenly silent faces, and David hands her the payment. She opens the door, and as it has started to rain, she covers her head with her jacket and dashes down the walkway, closing the door behind her. Audrey removes her coat as she heads to the guest bedroom and disappears inside. In the kitchen, only the counter light is on, casting a soft glow where David stands by the phone. The driver of the truck slips and slides his way over to David, who looks at Audrey lying shivering in the grass before turning his gaze back to the driver. Elijah closes his eyes, and his face becomes a portrait of strength and determination. The interior of the station is a mesmerizing sight, with one enormous cavernous room, the size of a football field, flanked on both sides by giant pillars that rise into a misty, hand-painted ceiling. David stands quietly in a corner, observing the faces of passengers as they arrive and depart from the late-night trains.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
A small but growing collection of comics dramatically spills onto the floor in a haphazard manner as the man with a neatly tied ponytail carefully adjusts the wheelchair and commences moving down the aisle once more. After progressing just a short distance of a few feet, Elijah unexpectedly jerks and instinctively grabs hold of the other wheel, causing the wheelchair to crash violently into the opposite wall. This sudden collision results in even more comics being dislodged from their precarious positions, cascading down onto both the wheelchair and the surrounding floor in a chaotic tumble. As they persist in their journey down the aisle, a heavy silence envelops them until Elijah, without warning, jerks the wheelchair to the left once again. This abrupt movement leads to his metal brace and the wheelchair colliding with two racks, showering Elijah with yet another cascade of comics, resembling a paper waterfall. Observing this, the man with the ponytail then makes his way to the front counter, while Elijah remains seated in a trance-like state, slightly hunched over, his eyes fully fixated on a comic book resting in his lap. For the first time, his expression shifts noticeably as the man with the ponytail finishes dialing a number and glances over at Elijah while waiting for someone to answer on the other end. Slowly and deliberately, Elijah raises a single comic book in his hand, almost as if it is a sacred relic.

In an elegantly chic and trendy restaurant, David and Audrey find themselves comfortably perched on stools at one end of the bar, leisurely sipping their drinks, appearing to be deeply engrossed in their own individual thoughts and contemplations. Audrey leans in ever so slightly closer, and David's previously bright grin gradually fades away; they remain a mere foot apart, creating an intimate atmosphere. David takes a slow, deliberate sip of his drink and casts a glance at Audrey, who is patiently waiting for his response, her face tensing as though she is on the brink of becoming upset. Audrey's eyes begin to glisten with moisture as David's gaze finally meets hers, and he holds her stare for what feels like an eternity, creating a moment that seems to transcend time. The husband and wife sit cozily together in the corner of the bar, enjoying what feels like their second date, and Audrey stands beside David as he reaches into his pocket to retrieve his wallet. The babysitter, characterized by her striking black-dyed hair and vintage Buddy Holly-style glasses, stands ready to leave in the doorway as Audrey attempts to conceal her smile, which quickly fades away. The babysitter adjusts her distinctive Buddy Holly glasses, observing the two suddenly silent faces, and David hands her the payment with a gentle nod. As she opens the door, revealing the onset of rain outside, she covers her head with her jacket and dashes down the walkway, making sure to close the door behind her with a soft thud. Audrey then removes her coat as she makes her way toward the guest bedroom, where she disappears inside, seeking solitude. In the kitchen, only the counter light is on, casting a soft, warm glow over the area where David stands by the phone. Meanwhile, the driver of the truck, navigating cautiously, slips and slides his way over to David, who turns his gaze from Audrey, now lying shivering in the grass, back to the driver. Elijah, with a serene expression, closes his eyes, and his face transforms into a portrait of unwavering strength and determination. The interior of the station is a mesmerizing and awe-inspiring sight, with one enormous, cavernous room, the size of a football field, flanked on both sides by gigantic pillars that rise majestically into a misty, hand-painted ceiling. David stands quietly in a solitary corner, observing the varied faces of passengers as they arrive and depart from the late-night trains, each carrying their own untold stories and destinations.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the ponytail man carefully straightens the wheelchair, a handful of comics slips from their precarious stack and tumbles to the ground. He then begins to push the wheelchair down the aisle once more, moving forward with measured steps. After advancing a couple of feet, Elijah suddenly jerks, his hand darting out to grab the other wheel, which causes the wheelchair to veer sharply and ram violently into the opposite wall. This abrupt collision dislodges more comics, which cascade down, landing both on the wheelchair and the nearby ground. They continue their journey down the aisle, and a brief silence envelops them until Elijah once again jerks the wheelchair to the left. This sudden movement results in his metal brace and the wheelchair crashing into two racks, sending a flurry of comics cascading over Elijah, covering him completely. Meanwhile, the ponytail man makes his way to the front counter, leaving Elijah sitting in a trance-like state, slightly hunched over, his eyes fixated on a comic book resting in his lap. For the first time, his expression shifts as the ponytail man finishes dialing a number and glances over at Elijah, waiting for a response from the other end of the line. In response, Elijah slowly raises a single comic book in his hand. In a trendy restaurant, David and Audrey sit on stools at one end of the bar, each sipping their drinks while appearing lost in deep thought. Audrey leans slightly closer to David, whose grin gradually fades as they find themselves only a foot or so apart. David takes a slow sip of his drink, casting a glance at Audrey, who waits expectantly for his answer, her face tensing as if on the verge of becoming upset. Audrey's eyes begin to glaze with water as David lifts his gaze, making eye contact with her, and he holds her stare for what feels like an eternity. The couple, husband and wife, sit closely together in the corner of the bar on their second date, and Audrey stands next to David as he retrieves his wallet. The babysitter, with her black-dyed hair and Buddy Holly glasses, stands poised to leave in the doorway. Audrey attempts to conceal her smile, which quickly fades. The babysitter adjusts her Buddy Holly glasses, observing the two suddenly quiet faces, as David hands her the money. She opens the door, and noticing the rain, she covers her head with her jacket and dashes down the walkway, closing the door behind her. Audrey removes her coat as she moves toward the guest bedroom, disappearing inside. In the kitchen, only the counter light is on, casting a soft glow where David stands by the phone. Outside, the driver of the truck struggles to maintain his footing as he makes his way over to David, who looks at Audrey lying shivering in the grass before turning his gaze back to the driver. Meanwhile, Elijah closes his eyes, his face transforming with a newfound strength. Inside the station, the interior presents a mystical sight, with a vast cavernous room the size of a football field, flanked on both sides by giant pillars that rise into a misty, hand-painted ceiling. David stands quietly in a corner, observing the faces of passengers as they arrive and depart from late-night trains.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
The ponytail man straightens the wheelchair, causing a handful of comics to tumble to the ground as he starts down the aisle. Elijah jerks the wheelchair, crashing it into the opposite wall and knocking more comics onto the wheelchair and floor. As they continue, Elijah jerks left again, colliding with racks and covering himself in comics. The ponytail man moves to the front counter, while Elijah, in a trance, stares at a comic book in his lap, his expression changing as the ponytail man finishes dialing and looks over. Elijah raises a comic book in his hand.

In a trendy restaurant, David and Audrey sit at the bar, sipping drinks and deep in thought. Audrey leans closer, and David's grin fades as he slowly sips his drink, glancing at Audrey, who waits tensely for his answer. Her eyes glaze with water as they make prolonged eye contact. On their second date, they sit close together, and Audrey stands by David as he retrieves his wallet. The babysitter, with black-dyed hair and Buddy Holly glasses, stands ready to leave. Audrey's smile fades as David hands the babysitter money. She covers her head with her jacket and runs into the rain, closing the door behind her. Audrey removes her coat and moves to the guest bedroom, disappearing inside. David stands by the phone in the dimly lit kitchen. The truck driver slips over to David, who looks at Audrey shivering in the grass before turning back to the driver. Elijah closes his eyes, his face filled with strength. The station's interior is a mystical sight, with a vast cavernous room lined with giant pillars rising into a misty hand-painted ceiling. David stands quietly, observing passengers arriving and departing late-night trains.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: A handful of comics, including popular issues from the Golden Age of Comics known for their vibrant art and storytelling, tumbles to the ground as the ponytail man, who often volunteers at the local community center for individuals with disabilities, straightens the wheelchair and starts down the aisle again. After a couple of feet, Elijah, whose fascination with superheroes began after he read his first comic at the age of five, jerks and grabs the other wheel, sending the wheelchair ramming violently into the opposite wall, causing more comics to be knocked free and fall onto the wheelchair and the nearby ground. They move down the aisle of the local comic book shop, and all is quiet until Elijah jerks the wheelchair to the left again, causing his metal leg brace, a result of a childhood accident, and the wheelchair to crash into two racks, covering Elijah in comics. The Ponytail man moves to the front counter, where a vintage cash register sits, while Elijah sits in a trance—slightly hunched over—and his eyes stare at a comic book in his lap, featuring the legendary Superman. His expression changes for the first time as the Ponytail man finishes dialing an antique rotary phone and looks over to Elijah as he waits for a voice on the other end. Elijah raises a single comic book in his hand, its cover depicting a heroic battle scene. In a trendy restaurant, known for its innovative fusion dishes and modern decor, David and Audrey are on stools at one end of the bar, sipping their drinks as they appear in deep thought. Audrey leans slightly closer, and David's grin slowly fades; they're only a foot or so apart. David sips his artisanal cocktail slowly and glances at Audrey, who waits for his answer, her face tensing as she's on the verge of getting upset. Audrey's eyes glaze with water as David's eyes look up and make eye contact with hers, and he stares at her for the longest time. Husband and wife sit close together in the corner of the bar on their second date since rekindling their romance, and Audrey stands next to David as he pulls out his wallet, carefully crafted from genuine leather, as the babysitter with the black-dyed hair and Buddy Holly glasses, a vintage fashion statement inspired by the famous 1950s musician, stands ready to leave in the doorway as Audrey tries to hide her smile, which instantly fades. The babysitter fixes her Buddy Holly glasses as she looks at the two suddenly quiet faces, and David hands her the money. She opens the door, and it's started to rain, reminiscent of the frequent downpours during the city's rainy season, so she covers her head with her jacket and runs down the walkway, closing the door behind her. Audrey takes off her coat as she moves to the guest bedroom, which they recently redecorated in soothing earth tones, and disappears inside. Only the counter light is on in the kitchen, casting a warm glow, where David stands by the phone. The driver of the truck, known for its delivery of fresh produce to local restaurants, slips and slides his way over to David, who looks at Audrey laying shivering in the grass after their impromptu late-night swim, before looking back at the driver. Elijah closes his eyes, and his face fills with strength as he imagines himself as one of the comic book heroes he admires. The interior of the station is a mystical sight, with one huge cavernous room, a football field in size, reminiscent of the grand designs of early 20th-century architecture, lined on both sides with giant pillars rising into a misty hand-painted ceiling, depicting scenes of celestial wonder. David stands in a quiet corner and watches the faces of passengers arriving and departing late-night trains, some weary from their journeys and others filled with the anticipation of new adventures.

David stands in a quiet corner and watches the faces of passengers arriving and departing. latenight trains.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: A handful of comics tumbles to the ground as the ponytail man straightens the wheelchair and starts down the aisle again. After a couple of feet Elijah jerks and grabs the other wheel sending the wheelchair ramming violently into the opposite wall causing more comics to be knocked free and fall onto the wheelchair and the nearby ground. They move down the aisle and all is quiet until Elijah jerks the wheelchair to the left again causing his metal brace and the wheelchair to crash into two racks covering Elijah in comics. The Ponytail man moves to the front counter while Elijah sits in a trance—slightly hunched over—and his eyes stare at a comic book in his lap. His expression changes for the first time as the Ponytail man finishes dialing and looks over to Elijah as he waits for a voice. on the other end Elijah raises a single comic book in his hand. In a trendy restaurant David and Audrey are on stools at one end of the bar sipping their drinks as they appear in deep thought. Audrey leans slightly closer and David's grin slowly fades. they are only a foot or so apart. David sips his drink slowly and glances at Audrey who waits for his answer her face tensing as she is on the verge of getting upset. Audrey's eyes glaze with water as David's eyes look up and make eye contact with hers and he stares at her for the longest time. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Husband and wife sit close together in the corner of the bar on their second date and Audrey stands next to David as he pulls out his wallet. The babysitter with the black dyed hair and Buddy Holly glasses stands ready to leave in the doorway as Audrey tries to hide her smile which instantly fades. The babysitter fixes her Buddy Holly glasses as she looks at the two suddenly quiet faces and David hands her the money. She opens the door and it is started to rain so she covers her head with her jacket and runs down the walkway closing the door behind her. Audrey takes off her coat as she moves to the guest bedroom and disappears inside. Only the counter light is on in the kitchen where David stands by the phone. The driver of the truck slips and slides his way over to David who looks at Audrey laying shivering in the grass before looking back at the driver. Elijah closes his eyes and his face fills with strength. The interior of the station is a mystical sight with one huge cavernous room a football field in size lined on both sides with giant pillars rising into a misty handpainted ceiling. David stands in a quiet corner and watches the faces of passengers arriving and departing. latenight trains.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: A handful of comics tumbles to the ground as the penguin straightens the wheelchair and starts down the aisle again. After a couple of feet, the zebra jerks and grabs the other wheel, sending the wheelchair ramming violently into the opposite wall, causing more comics to be knocked free and fall onto the wheelchair and the nearby ground. They move down the aisle, and all is quiet until the zebra jerks the wheelchair to the left again, causing the zebra's metal brace and the wheelchair to crash into two racks, covering the zebra in comics. The penguin moves to the front counter, while the zebra sits in a trance—slightly hunched over—and the zebra's eyes stare at a comic book in the zebra's lap. The zebra's expression changes for the first time as the penguin finishes dialing and looks over to the zebra as the penguin waits for a voice on the other end. The zebra raises a single comic book in the zebra's hand. In a trendy restaurant, the astronaut and the mermaid are on stools at one end of the bar, sipping their drinks as they appear in deep thought. The mermaid leans slightly closer, and the astronaut's grin slowly fades; they're only a foot or so apart. The astronaut sips the astronaut's drink slowly and glances at the mermaid, who waits for the astronaut's answer, her face tensing as she's on the verge of getting upset. The mermaid's eyes glaze with water as the astronaut's eyes look up and make eye contact with hers, and the astronaut stares at her for the longest time. The fox and the crane sit close together in the corner of the bar on their second date, and the mermaid stands next to the astronaut as the astronaut pulls out the astronaut's wallet. The unicorn with the black dyed hair and Buddy Holly glasses stands ready to leave in the doorway as the mermaid tries to hide her smile, which instantly fades. The unicorn fixes her Buddy Holly glasses as she looks at the two suddenly quiet faces, and the astronaut hands her the money. She opens the door, and it's started to rain, so she covers her head with her jacket and runs down the walkway, closing the door behind her. The mermaid takes off her coat as she moves to the guest bedroom and disappears inside. Only the counter light is on in the kitchen where the astronaut stands by the phone. The pirate of the truck slips and slides his way over to the astronaut, who looks at the mermaid laying shivering in the grass before looking back at the pirate. The zebra closes the zebra's eyes, and the zebra's face fills with strength. The interior of the station is a mystical sight, with one huge cavernous room, a football field in size, lined on both sides with giant pillars rising into a misty hand-painted ceiling. The astronaut stands in a quiet corner and watches the faces of passengers arriving and departing late-night trains.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A handful of marbles tumbles to the ground as the ponytail man straightens the shopping cart and starts down the hallway again. After a couple of feet, Elijah jerks and grabs the other handle, sending the shopping cart ramming violently into the opposite window, causing more marbles to be knocked free and fall onto the shopping cart and the nearby floor. They move down the hallway, and all is quiet until Elijah jerks the cart to the left again, causing his wooden crutch and the cart to crash into two mannequins, covering Elijah in marbles. The Ponytail man moves to the reception desk, while Elijah sits in a trance—slightly hunched over—and his eyes stare at a marble in his lap. His expression changes for the first time as the Ponytail man finishes dialing and looks over to Elijah as he waits for a voice on the other end. Elijah raises a single marble in his hand. In a trendy gallery, David and Audrey are on bean bags at one end of the display, sipping their sodas as they appear in deep thought. Audrey leans slightly closer, and David's grin slowly fades; they're only a foot or so apart. David sips his soda slowly and glances at Audrey, who waits for his answer, her face tensing as she's on the verge of getting upset. Audrey's eyes glaze with water as David's eyes look up and make eye contact with hers, and he stares at her for the longest time. Husband and wife sit close together in the corner of the gallery on their second date, and Audrey stands next to David as he pulls out his wallet. The babysitter with the red dyed hair and aviator glasses stands ready to leave in the hallway as Audrey tries to hide her smile, which instantly fades. The babysitter fixes her aviator glasses as she looks at the two suddenly quiet faces, and David hands her the cash. She opens the window, and it's started to snow, so she covers her head with her umbrella and runs down the staircase, closing the window behind her. Audrey takes off her scarf as she moves to the study and disappears inside. Only the floor lamp is on in the living room where David stands by the window. The sailor of the boat slips and slides his way over to David, who looks at Audrey laying shivering in the sand before looking back at the sailor. Elijah closes his eyes, and his face fills with determination. The interior of the museum is a mystical sight, with one huge cavernous room, a tennis court in size, lined on both sides with giant columns rising into a misty hand-painted ceiling. David stands in a quiet corner and watches the faces of visitors arriving and departing late-night exhibits.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: A handful of comics levitates into the air as the ponytail man spins the wheelchair and floats down the aisle again. After a couple of feet, Elijah twitches and releases the other wheel, sending the wheelchair gliding gently into the opposite wall, prompting more comics to drift free and settle onto the wheelchair and the nearby ground. They hover down the aisle, and all is quiet until Elijah nudges the wheelchair to the left again, leading his metal brace and the wheelchair to softly brush against two racks, enveloping Elijah in comics. The Ponytail man drifts to the front counter, while Elijah rests in a trance—slightly leaning forward—and his eyes fixate on a comic book in his lap. His expression shifts for the first time as the Ponytail man completes dialing and glances over to Elijah as he waits for a response on the other end. Elijah lifts a single comic book in his hand. In a trendy restaurant, David and Audrey are perched on stools at one end of the bar, swirling their drinks as they appear lost in thought. Audrey moves slightly closer, and David's grin gradually vanishes; they're only a foot or so apart. David swirls his drink slowly and glimpses at Audrey, who anticipates his answer, her face tensing as she's on the verge of getting upset. Audrey's eyes gleam with water as David's eyes drift up and make eye contact with hers, and he gazes at her for the longest time. Husband and wife lean close together in the corner of the bar on their second date, and Audrey stands next to David as he retrieves his wallet. The babysitter with the black dyed hair and Buddy Holly glasses stands prepared to leave in the doorway as Audrey tries to conceal her smile, which instantly vanishes. The babysitter adjusts her Buddy Holly glasses as she peers at the two suddenly silent faces, and David passes her the money. She opens the door, and it's begun to drizzle, so she shields her head with her jacket and strolls down the walkway, closing the door behind her. Audrey sheds her coat as she glides to the guest bedroom and vanishes inside. Only the counter light is on in the kitchen where David lounges by the phone. The driver of the truck tiptoes his way over to David, who observes Audrey laying quivering in the grass before glancing back at the driver. Elijah opens his eyes, and his face brightens with resolve. The interior of the station is a magical sight, with one enormous cavernous room, a football field in size, lined on both sides with enormous pillars reaching into a misty hand-painted ceiling. David leans in a quiet corner and scans the faces of passengers arriving and departing late-night trains.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A bundle of umbrellas tumbles to the ground as the cactus woman straightens the refrigerator and starts down the hallway again. After a couple of feet, Max jerks and grabs the other fan, sending the refrigerator ramming violently into the opposite shelf, causing more umbrellas to be knocked free and fall onto the refrigerator and the nearby floor. They move down the hallway, and all is quiet until Max jerks the refrigerator to the left again, causing his metal lantern and the refrigerator to crash into two televisions, covering Max in umbrellas. The cactus woman moves to the front garden, while Max sits in a trance—slightly hunched over—and his eyes stare at a lamp in his lap. His expression changes for the first time as the cactus woman finishes dialing and looks over to Max as he waits for a whistle on the other end. Max raises a single lamp in his hand. In a trendy boutique, Lucy and Jasper are on hammocks at one end of the patio, sipping their puddings as they appear in deep thought. Lucy leans slightly closer, and Jasper's grin slowly fades; they're only a foot or so apart. Jasper sips his pudding slowly and glances at Lucy, who waits for his answer, her face tensing as she's on the verge of getting upset. Lucy's eyes glaze with marbles as Jasper's eyes look up and make eye contact with hers, and he stares at her for the longest time. Painter and musician sit close together in the corner of the patio on their second expedition, and Lucy stands next to Jasper as he pulls out his compass. The teacher with the white silk scarf and Elvis glasses stands ready to leave in the doorway as Lucy tries to hide her giggle, which instantly fades. The teacher fixes her Elvis glasses as she looks at the two suddenly quiet armchairs, and Jasper hands her the bookmark. She opens the window, and it's started to sprinkle, so she covers her head with her umbrella and runs down the pathway, closing the window behind her. Lucy takes off her scarf as she moves to the guest spa and disappears inside. Only the shelf light is on in the gallery where Jasper stands by the horn. The conductor of the bicycle slips and slides his way over to Jasper, who looks at Lucy lying shivering in the meadow before looking back at the conductor. Max closes his eyes, and his face fills with courage. The interior of the mansion is a mystical sight, with one huge cavernous wardrobe, a basketball court in size, lined on both sides with giant paintings rising into a misty hand-painted horizon. Jasper stands in a quiet corner and watches the expressions of pigeons arriving and departing late-night banquets.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: A collection of magazines scatters to the ground as the bowler hat gentleman adjusts the skateboard and meanders down the aisle again. After a couple of feet, Caroline jolts and twists the other wheel, sending the skateboard gliding calmly into the opposite wall, causing more magazines to be dislodged and drop onto the skateboard and the nearby ground. They drift down the aisle, and all is silent until Caroline nudges the skateboard to the right again, causing her wooden cane and the skateboard to brush against two shelves, enveloping Caroline in magazines. The bowler hat gentleman strolls to the front register, while Caroline sits in a daze—slightly slumped forward—and her eyes fixate on a magazine in her lap. Her expression shifts for the first time as the bowler hat gentleman finishes typing and glances over to Caroline as he anticipates a response on the other end. Caroline lifts a single magazine in her grasp. In a stylish cafe, Charles and Natalie are on chairs at one end of the counter, sipping their beverages as they appear in deep contemplation. Natalie leans slightly nearer, and Charles's smirk slowly dissipates; they're only a foot or so apart. Charles sips his beverage slowly and peeks at Natalie, who anticipates his reply, her face tensing as she's on the edge of becoming distressed. Natalie’s eyes blur with moisture as Charles's eyes glance up and connect with hers, and he gazes at her for the longest time. Friends sit close together in the nook of the bar on their second outing, and Natalie stands next to Charles as he reveals his wallet. The assistant with the auburn dyed hair and round glasses stands prepared to depart in the threshold as Natalie attempts to conceal her grin, which suddenly vanishes. The assistant adjusts her round glasses as she observes the two abruptly quiet faces, and Charles hands her the payment. She opens the door, and it's begun to rain, so she shields her head with her sweater and jogs down the path, closing the door behind her. Natalie removes her jacket as she heads to the guest chamber and slips inside. Only the counter light illuminates the kitchen where Charles stands by the intercom. The cyclist slips and glides his way over to Charles, who observes Natalie resting trembling in the grass before looking back at the cyclist. Caroline shuts her eyes, and her face fills with determination. The interior of the garage is a magical sight, with one vast expansive chamber, a basketball court in size, lined on both sides with massive columns soaring into a dusty hand-painted ceiling. Charles stands in a secluded corner and observes the expressions of commuters arriving and departing late-night buses.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: A handful of newspapers cascades to the floor as the ponytail man adjusts the scooter and begins up the corridor again. After a couple of inches, Elijah jolts and clutches the other handle, sending the scooter sliding swiftly into the adjacent shelf, causing more newspapers to be jostled loose and land onto the scooter and the nearby floor. They glide up the corridor, and all is silent until Elijah swerves the scooter to the right once more, causing his leather belt and the scooter to collide with two displays, engulfing Elijah in newspapers. The Ponytail man heads to the back booth, while Elijah sits in contemplation—slightly tilted forward—and his gaze fixes on a newspaper in his lap. His demeanor shifts for the first time as the Ponytail man finishes texting and glances at Elijah as he anticipates a reply on the other side. Elijah raises a single newspaper in his hand. In a vintage café, David and Audrey are on benches at one end of the counter, nibbling their pastries as they appear deep in reflection. Audrey leans slightly nearer, and David's chuckle gradually vanishes; they're only a few inches apart. David nibbles his pastry slowly and peeks at Audrey, who bides her time for his response, her face tightening as she's on the brink of annoyance. Audrey's eyes glisten with moisture as David's eyes rise and lock with hers, and he gazes at her for an extended moment. Husband and wife sit close together in the nook of the café on their second outing, and Audrey stands beside David as he retrieves his phone. The caregiver with the purple streaked hair and aviator glasses stands ready to depart in the hallway as Audrey tries to suppress her grin, which rapidly dissolves. The caregiver adjusts her aviator glasses as she glances at the now silent faces, and David hands her the envelope. She pushes the door open, and it's beginning to drizzle, so she shields her hair with her hoodie and dashes down the path, shutting the door behind her. Audrey removes her scarf as she advances to the guest room and slips inside. Only the overhead light is on in the dining room where David stands by the computer. The pedestrian in the street slips and creeps his way over to David, who gazes at Audrey lying trembling in the bushes before looking back at the pedestrian. Elijah shuts his eyes, and his face radiates confidence. The interior of the theater is an enchanting scene, with one vast cavernous hall, a basketball court in size, arrayed on both sides with enormous columns reaching into a misty hand-painted sky. David stands in a secluded corner and observes the expressions of travelers boarding and leaving late-night buses.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A cluster of penguins tumbles to the ocean as the sombrero cat flattens the skateboard and skips up the staircase once more. After a couple of inches, Fiona twitches and grabs the red balloon, sending the skateboard bouncing gently into the nearby lamp, causing more penguins to be jostled loose and float onto the skateboard and the nearby ocean. They skip up the staircase, and all is calm until Fiona twitches the skateboard to the right again, causing her golden hat and the skateboard to glide into two paintings, showering Fiona in penguins. The Sombrero cat slides to the back column, while Fiona perches in a daze—slightly leaning back—and her eyes fixate on a penguin feather in her hands. Her demeanor shifts for the first time as the Sombrero cat finishes whistling and looks over to Fiona as he waits for a melody on the other end. Fiona lifts a single penguin feather in her paw. In a rustic café, Zoe and Oliver are on cushions at one end of the fireplace, munching their apples as they appear in deep conversation. Oliver leans slightly closer, and Zoe’s smirk slowly evaporates; they're only an inch or so apart. Oliver munches his apple slowly and peers at Zoe, who waits for his reply, her face tightening as she's on the brink of getting puzzled. Zoe’s eyes shimmer with sparkles as Oliver’s eyes gaze up and make contact with hers, and he gazes at her for the longest while. Siblings nestle close together in the corner of the café on their second morning, and Zoe stands next to Oliver as he pulls out his guitar. The gardener with the striped beanie and round spectacles stands poised to leap in the archway as Zoe tries to conceal her grin, which instantly disappears. The gardener adjusts her round spectacles as she gazes at the two suddenly silent faces, and Oliver hands her the scarf. She opens the gate, and it's begun to snow, so she shields her head with her umbrella and dances down the pathway, closing the gate behind her. Zoe removes her scarf as she wanders to the secret garden and vanishes inside. Only the lantern light is on in the gazebo where Oliver stands by the violin. The captain of the canoe slips and slides his way over to Oliver, who gazes at Zoe laying trembling in the meadow before gazing back at the captain. Fiona shuts her eyes, and her face fills with wisdom. The interior of the theater is a magical spectacle, with one enormous spacious room, a basketball court in size, lined on both sides with towering statues rising into a misty hand-painted sky. Oliver stands in a tranquil nook and observes the expressions of performers arriving and departing late-night concerts.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A man with a ponytail struggles with Elijah in a wheelchair, causing comics to scatter around. Elijah, momentarily entranced, changes expression while holding a comic as the man makes a call. In a trendy restaurant, David and Audrey sit, deep in thought and emotionally tense, as they navigate their second date. David's responses cause Audrey to become visibly upset, their interaction charged and silent. Meanwhile, a babysitter with distinctive glasses departs, leaving the couple in their quiet home. Later, David stands by the phone, reflecting. As Elijah gains internal strength, David watches passengers at a mystical, cavernous train station, pondering the quiet faces of those arriving and departing.

bar sipping their drinks as they appear in deep thought  The driver of the truck slips and slides his way over to David who looks at Audrey laying shivering in the grass before looking back at the driver

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: Husband and wife sit close together in the corner of the bar on their second date and Audrey stands next to David as he pulls out his wallet  The babysitter with the black dyed hair and Buddy Holly glasses stands ready to leave in the doorway as Audrey tries to hide her smile which instantly fades  The babysitter fixes her Buddy Holly glasses as she looks at the two suddenly quiet faces and David hands her the money  She opens the door and it's started to rain so she covers her head with her jacket and runs down the walkway closing the door behind her  Audrey takes off her coat as she moves to the guest bedroom and disappears inside  Only the counter light is on in the kitchen where David stands by the phone  The driver of the truck slips and slides his way over to David who looks at Audrey laying shivering in the grass before looking back at the driver  Elijah closes his eyes and his face fills with strength  The interior of the station is a mystical sight with one huge cavernous room a football field in size lined on both sides with giant pillars rising into a misty handpainted ceiling  David stands in a quiet corner and watches the faces of passengers arriving and departing latenight trains A handful of comics tumbles to the ground as the ponytail man straightens the wheelchair and starts down the aisle again  After a couple of feet Elijah jerks and grabs the other wheel sending the wheelchair ramming violently into the opposite wall causing more comics to be knocked free and fall onto the wheelchair and the nearby ground  They move down the aisle and all is quiet until Elijah jerks the wheelchair to the left again causing his metal brace and the wheelchair to crash into two racks covering Elijah in comics  The Ponytail man moves to the front counter while Elijah sits in a trance—slightly hunched over—and his eyes stare at a comic book in his lap  His expression changes for the first time as the Ponytail man finishes dialing and looks over to Elijah as he waits for a voice  on the other end Elijah raises a single comic book in his hand  In a trendy restaurant David and Audrey are on stools at one end of the bar sipping their drinks as they appear in deep thought  Audrey leans slightly closer and David's grin slowly fades  they're only a foot or so apart  David sips his drink slowly and glances at Audrey who waits for his answer her face tensing as she's on the verge of getting upset  Audrey's eyes glaze with water as David's eyes look up and make eye contact with hers and he stares at her for the longest time
